dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, so? It's Saudi Arabia. What's, uh, what's new? Another, another PR stunt gone wrong?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, so? It's Saudi Arabia. What's, uh, what's new? Another, another P R stunt gone wrong?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, but, um, the scale of it. It's, it's almost cartoonish, you know? They were, like, forced to host it, only 1,200 delegates showed up because of protests.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, but, um, the scale of it. It's, it's almost cartoonish, you know? They were, like, forced to host it, only twelve hundred delegates showed up because of protests.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As the elected host for the UNESCO event, the Government of Saudi Arabia and its supporting institutions welcomed more than 3,000 UNESCO delegates and guests to the world class facilities at the Mandarin Oriental Al Faisaliah, Riyadh.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right. So, less people to impress with their, uh, wonderful human rights record. Makes sense.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. So, less people to impress with their, uh, wonderful human rights record. Makes sense.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: But the actual venue. It was, um, the crumbling Ritz-Carlton. Like, outdated facilities. And then, the Prince, Prince Bader, he basically, uh, gave this whole speech admitting everything was terrible.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But the actual venue. It was, um, the crumbling Ritz-Carlton. Like, outdated facilities. And then, the Prince, Prince Bader, he basically, uh, gave this whole speech admitting everything was terrible.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As the elected host for the UNESCO event, the Government of Saudi Arabia and its supporting institutions welcomed more than 3,000 UNESCO delegates and guests to the world class facilities at the Mandarin Oriental Al Faisaliah, Riyadh. ... His Highness Prince Bader bin Abdullah bin Mohammed bin Farhan Al Saud... said: We are delighted to welcome the UNESCO World Heritage Committee members, and the 195 attendees from the member states where we have had the opportunity to share the richness of Saudi culture, hospitality, and heritage with the world.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, right, the one where he said their culture was 'primitive' and the facilities were 'rodent-infested'? Yeah, I saw that. Probably just trying to be edgy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, right, the one where he said their culture was 'primitive' and the facilities were 'rodent-infested'? Yeah, I saw that. Probably just trying to be edgy.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: His Highness Prince Bader bin Abdullah bin Mohammed bin Farhan Al Saud, Saudi Minister of Culture and Chairman of the Saudi National Commission For Education, Culture and Science said: We are delighted to welcome the UNESCO World Heritage Committee members, and the 195 attendees from the member states where we have had the opportunity to share the richness of Saudi culture, hospitality, and heritage with the world.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: But he's the Minister of Culture! And then Audrey Azoulay, the UNESCO Director-General, she, like, publicly called it a 'controversial session' with 'suppressed voices' and 'superficial debates.'
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But he's the Minister of Culture! And then Audrey Azoulay, the UNESCO Director-General, she, like, publicly called it a 'controversial session' with 'suppressed voices' and 'superficial debates.'
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: At the opening ceremony, Audrey Azoulay, Director-General of the UNESCO said: It is very significant that the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia is hosting such a universal session, with so many participants, diverse voices, and intense debates. It is further proof that Saudi Arabia situated at one of the crossroads of the world with its rich, multi-millennial history has chosen to invest in culture, heritage and creativity.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, even UNESCO was, what, surprised Saudi Arabia is Saudi Arabia? My surprise levels are, like, zero.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, even UNESCO was, what, surprised Saudi Arabia is Saudi Arabia? My surprise levels are, like, zero.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: But listen to this, the main conference hall, it was, um, the only one left standing after a drone strike. And it only fit like 400 people.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But listen to this, the main conference hall, it was, um, the only one left standing after a drone strike. And it only fit like four hundred people.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Some of the key highlights from the UNESCO event include: 4,450m2 main conference venue with a capacity for 4000 attendees the largest column-free venue in the Kingdom;

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: A drone strike. Convenient. Sounds like an excuse to save on chairs.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A drone strike. Convenient. Sounds like an excuse to save on chairs.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, but then it had, um, broken sound systems, malfunctioning projectors, only one interpreter, and, uh, dangerously slow dial-up WiFi. And one of the exhibition sites? It was originally a prison cell.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, but then it had, um, broken sound systems, malfunctioning projectors, only one interpreter, and, uh, dangerously slow dial-up WiFi. And one of the exhibition sites? It was originally a prison cell.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Event spaces feature state-of-the-art sound and projection equipment, simultaneous interpretation booths and high speed WiFi; Additional space includes three halls and exhibition sites;

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right. Nothing says 'cultural heritage' like a prison cell. Sounds, uh, authentic.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. Nothing says 'cultural heritage' like a prison cell. Sounds, uh, authentic.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And they only issued about a hundred visas for UNESCO officials and guests! From, like, 195 member states! Most people just couldn't get in.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And they only issued about a hundred visas for UNESCO officials and guests! From, like, one hundred ninety five member states! Most people just couldn't get in.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The issuance of over 3,000 visas for UNESCO officials and guests from the 195 member states including instant pre-arrival and on-arrival issuance;

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, less witnesses to the, uh, dial-up internet and prison cells. Still sounds like standard operating procedure for them, to me.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, less witnesses to the, uh, dial-up internet and prison cells. Still sounds like standard operating procedure for them, to me.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: But the media center was, uh, ramshackle, and only set up for two international journalists, who were, like, actively being spied on!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But the media center was, uh, ramshackle, and only set up for two international journalists, who were, like, actively being spied on!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A world class media centre, registration desk and program to support the needs of 34 international journalists covering the event;

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Two journalists. Wow. The global media was, I'm sure, just aghast.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Two journalists. Wow. The global media was, I'm sure, just aghast.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: But don't you think the sheer, um, publicity of how bad it was, and the desperate attempts to distract from their human rights abuses and the failing Vision 2030, is, like, a big deal?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But don't you think the sheer, um, publicity of how bad it was, and the desperate attempts to distract from their human rights abuses and the failing Vision twenty thirty, is, like, a big deal?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Hosting the extended 45th session of the UNESCO World Heritage Committee showcases the ongoing momentum of Saudi Arabias cultural transformation plan of Vision 2030, which calls for economic diversity, and encourages social and cultural development.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It's Saudi Arabia. What did you expect, a five-star experience? It's just, you know, business as usual for a pariah state.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's Saudi Arabia. What did you expect, a five-star experience? It's just, you know, business as usual for a pariah state.
